attributes.comment:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am writing to plead with you to not raise the fees proposed in Docket Number
USCIS-2006-0044. My family is going through the process of adoption at this
time. We have already paid hundreds of dollars to get our I-600A and are going
to have to pay those fees all over again because the wait time for Chinese
adoption has tripled since we started. Our papers and fingerprints will expire
before we travel, therefore forcing us to go through the process all over again.
It's hard enough on our budget to have to find another $615 for this. But if
this proposal passes, we will pay another 22% more. Our adoption is costing
around $20,000. This equals half of my husband's yearly take-home pay. We are
sacrificing, though, because we feel very strongly about giving an orphan a
loving home and a forever family to call her own. Please consider the financial
strain we, as adoptive families, are under. Don't raise the fees and make it
that much harder on us. Thank you for your consideration.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By E. Smith
